conclusion: To determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the paths from points A, B, C, and D.
A is connected to a blue baffle.
The blue baffle directs the flow downward.
The liquid will flow into the blue container G.
B is connected to a yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the flow downward.
The liquid will flow into the yellow container E.
C is connected to a green baffle.
The green baffle directs the flow downward.
The liquid will flow into the blue container G.
D is connected to an orange baffle.
The orange baffle directs the flow downward.
The liquid will flow into the brown container F.
Liquid from A will flow into container G.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
Liquid from C will flow into container G.
Liquid from D will flow into container F.
The liquid will flow into containers E, F, and G from points A, B, C, and D, respectively.
A and C will flow into G.
B will flow into E.
D will flow into F.
